item.title: [PI] sendGlobalMessage - Can be used for yell, global drops, and more!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:14, topic:522995”] public void sendGlobalMessage(String msg) { for (Player player : PlayerHandler.players) { if (player != null) { ((Client) player).sendMessage(msg); } } }[/quote]
Exactly like Vain said but different naming

I’ll edit the OP to make you guys happy. Like I said, I ripped it from yell, didn’t bother to make it better

item.title: [PI] sendGlobalMessage - Can be used for yell, global drops, and more!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

This is a super, super simple snippet. It gets rid of the need to add a for loop to any part of your code if you’re trying to send a global message.

Add this into your PlayerAssistant.java:

	public void sendGlobalMessage(String message){
		for (Player client : PlayerHandler.players) {
			if (client != null) {
				((Client) client).sendMessage(message);
			}
		}
	}

When ever you use just import PlayerAssistant and then do:
c.getPA().sendGlobalMessage(“Text”);

That’s all. I did say it was a snippet

Read full topic
